definitions: having sections that slide into one another for extending or collapsing
relating to or performed with a telescope for observing distant objects
examples: The telescopic ladder extended to reach the high ceiling
His telescopic fishing rod fits easily in the car
Telescopic observations revealed new details about the planet
The telescopic lens captured stunning images of the moon

definitions: revealing something significant or previously hidden about a situation or person
having a strong or marked effect that cannot be ignored
examples: Her telling glance revealed she knew the truth
The report contained several telling details about corruption
His telling argument convinced the entire jury
The team scored a telling victory in the playoffs

definitions: revealing or indicating something meant to be hidden or secret
examples: The telltale signs of stress appeared on his face
She noticed telltale footprints leading to the shed
Telltale smoke revealed their hidden campsite location
His telltale nervousness suggested he was lying

definitions: having frequent changes of mood or being emotionally unpredictable and difficult
working unreliably or erratically, especially of machines or equipment
examples: The temperamental artist refused to perform without perfect conditions
Her temperamental nature made collaboration difficult
The temperamental old printer only works on certain days
Their temperamental heating system needs constant adjustment

definitions: having mild temperatures without extremes of heat or cold
showing moderation and self-restraint, especially in behavior or consumption
examples: The temperate climate makes this region ideal for wine
Temperate zones experience distinct seasonal changes
His temperate response calmed the heated debate
She maintained temperate habits throughout her long life

definitions: made less extreme or intense through moderating influence or control
strengthened and made resilient through special treatment, especially of glass or steel
examples: His tempered enthusiasm reflected years of experience
She gave a tempered response to avoid escalation
The tempered glass windshield shattered into tiny pieces
Tempered steel blades hold their edge much longer

definitions: having the effect of making something less extreme or harsh
examples: The tempering influence of experience guided his decisions
Her tempering words calmed the angry crowd
A tempering breeze cooled the hot afternoon air
His tempering presence helped stabilize the volatile meeting

definitions: having violent storms with strong winds and heavy rain
showing extreme and violent emotions or frequent dramatic changes
examples: The tempestuous sea tossed the small boat dangerously
Tempestuous weather forced all flights to be cancelled
Their tempestuous relationship ended in a dramatic breakup
The tempestuous debate lasted well into the night

definitions: relating to time or the sequence of events in time
relating to worldly affairs rather than spiritual matters
examples: Temporal sequences help us understand cause and effect
The temporal lobe processes auditory information
The church balanced temporal concerns with spiritual guidance
Kings wielded temporal power alongside religious authority

definitions: lasting for only a limited period of time rather than permanently
examples: The temporary bridge will be replaced next year
She took a temporary job while searching for permanent work
Their temporary separation strengthened their relationship eventually
Temporary housing was provided for flood victims

definitions: appearing attractive and making you want to have or do something
examples: The tempting aroma of fresh bread filled the bakery
It's tempting to skip work on such a beautiful day
She made a tempting offer that was hard to refuse
The tempting display of desserts caught everyone's attention

definitions: having the numerical value of one more than nine
examples: Ten students received perfect scores on the exam
The meeting starts at ten o'clock sharp
She bought ten apples at the farmers market
The ten commandments form the basis of the law

definitions: showing persistent determination and refusing to give up despite difficulties
tending to keep a firm hold of something physically or mentally
examples: The tenacious reporter pursued the story for months
Her tenacious efforts finally paid off with success
The plant's tenacious roots clung to the rocky cliff
His tenacious grip on old beliefs hindered progress

definitions: occupied by tenants who pay rent to live or work there
examples: The tenanted properties generated steady rental income
All tenanted apartments must meet safety standards
The newly tenanted office building reached full capacity
Tenanted farms covered most of the estate lands

definitions: soft and easy to cut or chew, not tough or hard
easily hurt or damaged physically or emotionally, requiring gentle treatment
showing gentleness, kindness and affectionate care towards someone
examples: The tender meat fell apart with a fork
These tender vegetables cook quickly in the steamer
Her tender skin burned easily in the sun
The tender young plants need protection from frost
His tender words comforted the crying child
She gave him a tender kiss on the forehead

definitions: having a tendency or inclination to do or be something
examples: People tending toward pessimism often expect the worst
Markets tending upward encouraged investor confidence
Children tending to be shy need gentle encouragement
The weather is tending toward improvement this week

definitions: ten times as great or as much in amount or degree
examples: Production increased tenfold after installing new machinery
The company experienced tenfold growth in five years
A tenfold increase in prices shocked consumers nationwide
Their tenfold improvement exceeded all expectations

definitions: relating to the highest normal adult male singing voice
examples: The tenor saxophone produces warm middle register tones
He sang the tenor part in the church choir
Famous tenor voices performed at the opera house
The tenor soloist received thunderous applause

definitions: stretched tight or rigid, especially muscles, showing physical strain
feeling or showing nervousness, anxiety, or inability to relax
examples: His tense muscles ached after the long workout
The rope became tense as weight was applied
The tense atmosphere made everyone uncomfortable
She felt tense waiting for the test results

definitions: relating to tension or the ability to be stretched without breaking
examples: The cable's tensile strength exceeded safety requirements
Engineers tested the tensile properties of new materials
Tensile forces acted on the bridge suspension cables
Spider silk has remarkable tensile qualities

definitions: not certain or fixed and likely to be changed or replaced
done without confidence, showing hesitation or lack of certainty
examples: They reached a tentative agreement pending final approval
The tentative schedule may change based on weather
She made a tentative suggestion during the meeting
His tentative steps showed fear of falling

definitions: coming after nine others in order or sequence
examples: She finished tenth in the marathon race
The tenth amendment protects states' rights
Today marks their tenth wedding anniversary celebration
The tenth floor offers panoramic city views

definitions: very weak or slight, lacking substance or strength
examples: Their tenuous connection barely survived the long separation
The evidence supporting his theory remains tenuous
She maintained a tenuous grip on consciousness
The tenuous thread of hope kept them going

definitions: having a permanent position, especially as a teacher at a university
examples: Tenured professors enjoy greater academic freedom
She became a tenured faculty member after six years
The tenured staff formed the core of the department
Only tenured teachers served on the review committee

definitions: only slightly warm, between hot and cold in temperature
showing little enthusiasm or interest, unenthusiastic
examples: The tepid bathwater needed more hot water added
She sipped the tepid coffee with disappointment
The audience gave tepid applause after the performance
His tepid response suggested he wasn't interested

definitions: forming or situated at the end or extremity of something
predicted to lead to death, especially of an illness
examples: The terminal station marked the end of the railway
Terminal buds appear at branch tips in spring
The doctor diagnosed him with terminal cancer
She provided care for terminal patients

definitions: brought to an end or stopped, especially abruptly or forcefully
examples: The terminated contract left both parties free
All terminated employees received severance packages
The terminated pregnancy was medically necessary
Their terminated relationship couldn't be repaired

definitions: consisting of three parts or elements, having three components
examples: The ternary number system uses digits zero through two
Composers often use ternary form in musical pieces
A ternary compound contains three different elements
The ternary relationship involved three equal partners

definitions: relating to the earth or its inhabitants rather than space
living on or in the ground rather than in water or air
examples: Terrestrial television broadcasts from ground-based transmitters
Scientists study both terrestrial and marine ecosystems
Terrestrial animals evolved from aquatic ancestors
The terrestrial habitat supports diverse plant species

definitions: extremely bad, poor in quality or highly unpleasant
causing fear or dread, extremely serious or severe
examples: The terrible weather ruined our vacation plans
She's terrible at remembering people's names
A terrible accident closed the highway for hours
The terrible storm destroyed hundreds of homes

definitions: extremely good, excellent or wonderful in quality
very great in amount, size, or intensity
examples: She did a terrific job organizing the event
The restaurant serves terrific Italian food
The car hit the wall at terrific speed
A terrific explosion shook the entire building

definitions: feeling extreme fear or terror about something
examples: The terrified child hid behind her mother
Terrified screams came from the haunted house
He was terrified of speaking in public
The terrified passengers braced for impact

definitions: causing extreme fear or terror in those who experience it
examples: The terrifying roller coaster reached incredible speeds
She had a terrifying experience during the earthquake
His terrifying appearance scared the children away
The terrifying diagnosis changed their lives forever

definitions: relating to the ownership or control of an area of land or sea
tending to defend an area of space against others
examples: The territorial dispute lasted for decades
Countries protect their territorial waters from foreign vessels
Cats are highly territorial animals
His territorial behavior made sharing difficult

definitions: using very few words, often in a way that seems rude
examples: His terse reply ended the conversation abruptly
The manager's terse email upset several employees
She gave terse answers during the interview
The terse statement revealed nothing about their plans

definitions: third in order, rank, or importance after primary and secondary
examples: Tertiary education includes universities and colleges
The tertiary sector provides services rather than goods
This is only a tertiary concern right now
Tertiary sources summarize primary and secondary materials

definitions: decorated with or arranged in a pattern of repeated shapes that fit together
examples: The tessellated floor displayed intricate geometric patterns
Ancient Roman tessellated pavements still survive today
The artist created tessellated designs using triangular tiles
Tessellated patterns covered the mosque's walls

definitions: proven to be reliable through experience or examination
subjected to examination or trial to determine quality or suitability
examples: These tested methods guarantee consistent results
She relies on tested recipes for dinner parties
All tested products met safety standards
The tested samples showed no contamination

definitions: relating to or affecting the testicles, the male reproductive glands
examples: Testicular cancer affects mainly younger men
Regular testicular examinations can detect problems early
The testicular tissue showed signs of inflammation
Testicular hormones regulate male characteristics

definitions: expressing appreciation or admiration for someone's achievements or qualities
serving as testimony or evidence of something
examples: The testimonial dinner honored his forty years of service
She received a testimonial plaque from grateful students
These testimonial letters support her job application
Customer testimonial videos increased sales significantly

definitions: tied or fastened with a rope or chain to restrict movement
limited or restricted in freedom or scope of action
examples: The tethered balloon floated above the fairground
Tethered animals grazed within their allowed area
She felt tethered to her desk job
Their tethered imagination limited creative solutions

definitions: being a perfect or typical example of something described in textbooks
examples: His symptoms were textbook signs of the flu
She executed a textbook landing despite bad weather
The case presented textbook symptoms of depression
Their textbook approach followed all standard procedures

definitions: relating to fabric or cloth, especially woven material
examples: The textile industry employs millions worldwide
Ancient textile fragments revealed sophisticated techniques
Textile manufacturing requires specialized machinery
The textile workers demanded better conditions

definitions: relating to or based on the actual words of a text
examples: Textual analysis revealed hidden meanings in the poem
The textual evidence supported her interpretation
Scholars debate textual variations in ancient manuscripts
His textual criticism challenged traditional readings

definitions: having a distinctive surface pattern or feel rather than being smooth
examples: The textured wallpaper added visual interest
Her textured hair required special care products
Textured paint concealed wall imperfections effectively
The textured fabric felt rough against skin

definitions: feeling or expressing gratitude and relief for something good
examples: She felt thankful for their support during illness
The thankful family celebrated their safe return
I'm thankful that nobody was seriously hurt
His thankful smile showed genuine appreciation

definitions: having become soft or liquid after being frozen
examples: The thawed chicken was ready for cooking
Thawed ground made planting possible again
Use thawed berries within two days
The thawed pipes began flowing normally

definitions: relating to theater or the performance of plays
exaggerated and excessively dramatic in manner or behavior
examples: Her theatrical training showed in every performance
The theatrical production won several awards
His theatrical gestures annoyed his colleagues
She made a theatrical exit from the meeting

definitions: believing in the existence of a god or gods, especially a creator
examples: Theistic religions share belief in divine creation
His theistic worldview shaped his moral values
The theistic argument relies on intelligent design
Most theistic philosophies address the problem of evil

definitions: relating to or based on subjects or themes of discourse or composition
examples: The thematic analysis revealed recurring patterns
Each movement had distinct thematic material
Thematic consistency strengthened the novel's impact
The exhibition's thematic arrangement enhanced understanding
